lead_paragraph: Evgeni Malkin, seen by many as the best hockey player in the world outside the N.H.L., surfaced in Los Angeles yesterday with his agents, five days after slipping away from his Russian Super League team during training camp in Helsinki, Finland. Malkin, selected second over all by the Pittsburgh Penguins in the 2004 draft, skated with about 20 N.H.L. players at the Los Angeles Kings’ practice rink in El Segundo, Calif.
